title: Police launch special security plan as O/L exam concludes
byline: Police have launched a special security plan to prevent possible unruly incidents among students following the conclusion of the G.C.E. Ordinary Level (O/L) examination.

title: IMF urges US to work with partners to ease trade restrictions
byline: The IMF on Wednesday (Feb 25) called on the United States to work with trading partners and find ways to mutually ease trade curbs, as it issued a review of the US economy.

title: Colombo residential land prices rise by 12.4% in second half of 2025
byline: Residential land prices in the Colombo District have risen by 12.4 per cent in the second half of 2025, from a year ago, followed by commercial land prices by 11.3 per cent, according to the Central Bank of Sri Lanka.

title: Sri Lanka-Portugal affirm commitment to further strengthen bilateral ties
byline: The Minister of State and Foreign Affairs of Portugal Paulo Rangel, on a working visit to Sri Lanka met the Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism Vijitha Herath on 24 February at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Colombo.

title: Showers expected in several areas after 2pm today
byline: Showers or thundershowers are likely at a few places in Southern province and in Ratnapura and Monaragala districts after 2.00 p.m.

title: CEB trade unions to stage six-hour token strike today
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) trade unions have decided to launch a token strike from noon to 6.00 p.m. today (26), citing the lack of response to their demands from relevant authorities.

title: Dy Minister holds talks to expand foreign employment pathways for Sri Lankans in South Korea
byline: Bilateral discussions have been held between Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs Arun Hemachandra and the Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs of the Republic of Korea, Eui-hae Cecilia Chung at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Korea in Seoul.

title: Government spending lifts global debt to a record $348 trillion in 2025, says IIF
byline: Global debt climbed to a record $348 trillion at the end of 2025, after nearly $29 trillion was added over the year in the fastest yearly build-up since the pandemic surge, a banking trade group reported on Wednesday.

title: Hong Kong court overturns China critic Jimmy Lai’s fraud conviction in rare legal victory
byline: Pro-democracy media tycoon Jimmy Lai’s fraud conviction and prison sentence were overturned by a Hong Kong court on Thursday, in a surprise legal decision that comes soon after Lai was jailed for 20 years on a separate national security charge.

title: Body of woman found in abandoned fishing boat in Ratmalana
byline: Police have launched an investigation after the body of a young woman was discovered inside an abandoned fishing boat along the Ratmalana beach yesterday (25), police stated.

title: Four shot dead on US-registered speedboat by border guards, Cuba says
byline: Four people who entered Cuban waters on a US-registered speedboat have been shot dead by border guards, Cuba’s government said.

title: Fire breaks out at Kerawalapitiya garbage dumping yard
byline: A fire has broken out at the Kerawalapitiya garbage dumping yard near the highway entrance.

title: Sri Lanka’s official poverty line rises in January
byline: Sri Lanka’s official poverty line has witnessed an increase in January, 2026 in comparison to figures from December 2025, a report by the Department of Census and Statistics revealed.

title: Customs officers continue trade union action over unresolved issues
byline: The black armband protest launched by customs trade unions will continue today (26) as well, the Customs Trade Union Alliance said.

title: Australian tourist drowns off Weligama coast
byline: An Australian national drowned while swimming off the coast of Pelena in Weligama yesterday (25), police stated.

title: Alarming surge in colon and rectal cancers among 30–50 age group in Sri Lanka: Health authorities
byline: Health authorities have raised concern over a growing incidence of colon and rectal cancers among individuals aged 30 to 50 in Sri Lanka, reflecting a similar global trend.

title: President to inaugurate ‘Himikama’ national programme in Anuradhapura
byline: The inaugural ceremony of the national programme for the presentation of ‘Himikama’ freehold title deeds to the general public will be held in Anuradhapura tomorrow.

title: Three teenage girls arrested over break-in at Kalutara stadium canteen
byline: Three teenage girls have been arrested for allegedly breaking into the canteen of the Vernon U Fernando Stadium in Kalutara and stealing confectioneries and chocolates worth nearly Rs. 40,000, police said.

title: Indian Navy’s sail training ship INS Tarangini to visit Trincomalee tomorrow
byline: Indian Navy’s Sail Training Ship INS Tarangini is scheduled to arrive in Trincomalee from tomorrow to March 02 and Colombo from March 06 to March 09.

title: Two including woman arrested over heroin racket in Panadura
byline: Two individuals have been arrested for operating a heroin racket under the guise of a funeral parlor by the Panadura North Police.

title: Adjournment debate in Parliament to mark International Women’s Day
byline: Parliament is scheduled to hold sittings from March 3 to 6, the Secretary-General of Parliament, Kushani Rohanadeera has stated.

title: Do not obstruct Easter Sunday attack investigations – Fr. Cyril Gamini
byline: The Director of Communications for the Archdiocese of Colombo, Rev. Fr. Cyril Gamini Fernando has urged all parties not to interfere with ongoing investigations into the 2019 Easter Sunday terror attacks.

title: PM Modi becomes first world leader to cross 100 million Instagram followers
byline: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday became the first world leader and politician to cross 100 million followers on Instagram, marking a new milestone in his global digital presence.

title: Hearing of case against ex-minister Chandrani Bandara moved to March
byline: The Colombo High Court has ordered that the case filed by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) against former Minister of Women and Child Affairs Chandrani Bandara over alleged corruption charges be taken up again on March 05, 2026.

title: Lanka IOC announces revised dealer commission effective Mar. 1
byline: Lanka IOC PLC has announced revised dealer commission for fuel, effective March 1, 2026. Issuing a statement, Lanka IOC said the revised rates for company-owned filling stations and franchisee-owned filling stations have been approved by the competent authority.

title: “India Gateway To Asia”: Israel prepares free trade agreement with Delhi
byline: As Prime Minister Narendra Modi began his two-day visit to Israel, Israeli Economy and Industry Minister Nir Barkat struck an upbeat, candid note in an exclusive interview with NDTV, calling India “a gateway to Asia” and predicting that a long-awaited India-Israel Free Trade Agreement could be clinched sooner than expected.

title: Hashish worth Rs. 30 million seized in Kirulapone
byline: A suspect has been apprehended in the Kirulapone are while in possession of 05 kilograms of Hashish.

title: SC dismisses petitions against emergency declaration after Cyclone Ditwah
byline: The Supreme Court has dismissed without taking up for consideration two fundamental rights (FR) petitions filed against the State of Public Emergency proclaimed by the President following Cyclone Ditwah, claiming that they are in violation of Fundamental Rights.

title: AI-driven entrepreneurship will transform Sri Lanka’s economy: Dy Minister
byline: A new transformation of Sri Lanka’s economy will be driven through entrepreneurship based on Artificial Intelligence (AI) technology, the Deputy Minister of Digital Economy, Eng. Eranga Weeraratne stated.

title: 2 arrested at BIA with undeclared goods including laptops, phones worth over Rs. 2 mln
byline: Two Sri Lankan passengers have been arrested by a team of Sri Lanka Customs officials at the airport this morning (26) for allegedly attempting to smuggle a consignment of undeclared goods including electronic items valued at approximately Rs. 2.06 million into the country.

title: New insurance scheme introduced for fishermen engaged in diving activities
byline: The Agricultural and Agrarian Insurance Board, operating under the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Land and Irrigation, has introduced a new insurance scheme for fishermen engaged in diving activities.

title: 73-year-old attacked to death by elder brother over land dispute in Elpitiya
byline: A personal dispute between two brothers has reportedly ended in a fatal assault at around 11.00 a.m. today (26) in the Polgaswatta area of Batuwanhena in Elpitiya, police said.

title: ‘Podi Lassie’ to be brought to Sri Lanka tomorrow from India?
byline: Janith Madushanka, alias “Podi Lassie”, a Sri Lankan underworld figure and alleged drug kingpin wanted by police in connection with several murders, is scheduled to be brought to the island tomorrow (27) morning, more than a year after his arrest in India.

title: Disaster Relief Officials to launch trade union action tomorrow
byline: Several trade unions representing public service officers engaged in disaster relief activities have decided to temporarily halt their duties and commence trade union action from tomorrow (27).

title: Hillary Clinton to testify in congressional Epstein probe
byline: Former US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton is due to testify behind closed doors on Thursday to a congressional committee investigating the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, though it is not clear how much new information will come to light.

title: Secretary to President directs officials to expedite relief efforts for Cyclone Ditwah victims
byline: The progress review meeting of the 16th session of the National Council for Disaster Management was held this morning (26) at the Presidential Secretariat under the patronage of the Secretary to the President, Dr Nandika Sanath Kumanayake.

title: Instagram to alert parents on teen suicide searches as UK weighs social media ban
byline: Instagram said it would notify parents if their teenager repeatedly searches for terms related to suicide or self-harm within a short period, as pressure grows for governments to follow Australia’s ban on the use of social media for under 16s.

title: Sri Lanka and Finland sign MoU on political consultation mechanism in Helsinki
byline: The Second Round of Bilateral Political Consultations between Sri Lanka and Finland was held in Helsinki, marking an important step in further strengthening the longstanding and cordial relations between the two countries.

title: Akuregoda double murder: owner of house where shooter was hiding arrested
byline: The owner of the house that allegedly provided shelter to the second shooter involved in the recent shooting and killing of a lawyer and his wife at a supermarket’s parking lot in Akuregoda has been arrested.
